basics.name: Jiaze Cai
basics.summary: Reseach Assistant in Hybrid Robotics Group

courses: Control of Robotic and Autonomous Systems
highlights: Concentration in Control of Robotic and Autonomous Systems

work.name: UC Berkeley, Hybrid Robotics Group
highlights: Designed a high-DoF bird-scale flapping-wing robot
Developed simulation environments for learning-based control
Implemented learning-based control framework for agile trajectory tracking
Deployed control policy on physical flapping-wing robot

work.name: Texas A&M University AVFL
highlights: Led project on Air-Launched Foldable Tail-Sitter design and testing
Implemented digital PID speed controller for hovering and vertical flight
Conducted horizontal flight design and stability analysis

projects.name: Scaled Next-Gen VTOL UAS
highlights: Led 20-person team in design and testing of VTOL Tail-Sitter
Implemented swashplate control for rotor system

projects.name: Next-Gen VTOL UAS
highlights: Developed control laws for transition flights

projects.name: TAMU SAE AERO Design
highlights: Incorporated Pixhawk flight controller for flight test data
Designed winglet and fairing with CFD analysis

publications.name: Learning-based Trajectory Tracking for Bird-inspired Flapping-Wing Robots
Development of a tube-launched tail-sitter unmanned aerial vehicle
A Fully Mechanical Realization of PID Controller
